Ahn is the product of a more current generation, but she fills her second album with songs that are just as timeless, from stripped-down Laurel Canyon folk tunes to lightly orchestrated chamber pop ballads. Yet despite the heavy guest list, When You Grow Up still feels more personal than AhnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s 2008 debut, which found her dabbling in indie pop, torch songs, and Norah Jones-styled jazz.
